channel.title: Need testers to see if they can connect?
channel.description:
i have a new server and ive got people to test it and the majority of them say that they can connect but one of them said that there is a java error when running up the client
*
thanks =)

item.title: Need testers to see if they can connect?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/technotes/tools/windows/javac.html

There is a source/target flag for a reason. Use it!

Read full topic
item.source: Need testers to see if they can connect?

item.title: Need testers to see if they can connect?
item.dc:creator: @T_R_V T R V
item.description:
@T_R_V wrote:

okay so ive uninstalled all java…installed jdk7/jre 7.recompiled both source and client side…rejarred it… is that all good to go now?

Read full topic
item.source: Need testers to see if they can connect?

item.title: Need testers to see if they can connect?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

T R V:

so would uninstalling it then installing jre 7 work? but i heard apparently the signlink has a java associated with it

I said to remove JRE or JDK 8 and recompile with JDK 7.

Yes, the signlink has “a java associated with it” because it’s a java file…
You need to compile it along with the rest of the files…

Read full topic
item.source: Need testers to see if they can connect?

item.title: Need testers to see if they can connect?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

T R V:

is there any way to downgrade it?

Uninstall it? Or compile with a lower JDK version?
You cannot “downgrade” the jar itself, you’ll have to send a new one out to your users.

Read full topic
item.source: Need testers to see if they can connect?

item.title: Need testers to see if they can connect?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Server Help is not your personal army. This is not something we’re here to do.

The error was probably a unsupported major minor error. Because for some reason everyone and their mother jumped the gun when JDK 8 (beta) came out and downloaded it. Then when average users (Who are still on 7, as it’s the latest public and official release) try to play it errors.

Read full topic
